subject: Re: Grammar question: Demonstrative vs. nondemonstrative "that"
msgSnippet: The NON-demonstrative that is the relative pronoun as in this sentence:  The dog that bit the cat got scratched .  As for why he would distinguish
messageBody: The NON-demonstrative "that" is the relative pronoun as in this sentence:  "The dog that bit the cat got scratched".  As for why he would distinguish them...I'm not sure.  Disambiguation would seem to be the only reason to do so, but context always tells us which "that" it is in real life.  So, who knows?
